occurrences.arabic_text: وَنَعْمَةٍ كَانُوا فِيهَا فَاكِهِينَ
occurrences.english_translation: And wealth (and conveniences of life), wherein they had taken such delight!

occurrences.arabic_text: فَمَا بَكَتْ عَلَيْهِمُ السَّمَاءُ وَالْأَرْضُ وَمَا كَانُوا مُنْظَرِينَ
occurrences.english_translation: And neither heaven nor earth shed a tear over them: nor were they given a respite (again).

occurrences.arabic_text: مِنْ فِرْعَوْنَ إِنَّهُ كَانَ عَالِيًا مِنَ الْمُسْرِفِينَ
occurrences.english_translation: Inflicted by Pharaoh, for he was arrogant (even) among inordinate transgressors.

occurrences.arabic_text: فَأْتُوا بِآبَائِنَا إِنْ كُنْتُمْ صَادِقِينَ
occurrences.english_translation: "Then bring (back) our forefathers, if what ye say is true!"

occurrences.arabic_text: أَهْلَكْنَاهُمْ إِنَّهُمْ كَانُوا مُجْرِمِينَ
occurrences.english_translation: What! Are they better than the people of Tubba and those who were before them? We destroyed them because they were guilty of sin.

occurrences.arabic_text: إِنَّ هَٰذَا مَا كُنْتُمْ بِهِ تَمْتَرُونَ
occurrences.english_translation: "Truly this is what ye used to doubt!"

occurrences.arabic_text: لِيَجْزِيَ قَوْمًا بِمَا كَانُوا يَكْسِبُونَ
occurrences.english_translation: Tell those who believe, to forgive those who do not look forward to the Days of Allah: It is for Him to recompense (for good or ill) each People according to what they have earned.

occurrences.arabic_text: إِنَّ رَبَّكَ يَقْضِي بَيْنَهُمْ يَوْمَ الْقِيَامَةِ فِيمَا كَانُوا فِيهِ يَخْتَلِفُونَ
occurrences.english_translation: And We granted them Clear Signs in affairs (of Religion): it was only after knowledge had been granted to them that they fell into schisms, through insolent envy among themselves. Verily thy Lord will judge between them on the Day of Judgment as to those matters in which they set up differences.

occurrences.arabic_text: مَا كَانَ حُجَّتَهُمْ إِلَّا أَنْ قَالُوا ائْتُوا بِآبَائِنَا إِنْ كُنْتُمْ صَادِقِينَ
occurrences.english_translation: And when Our Clear Signs are rehearsed to them their argument is nothing but this: They say, "Bring (back) our forefathers, if what ye say is true!"

occurrences.arabic_text: مَا كَانَ حُجَّتَهُمْ إِلَّا أَنْ قَالُوا ائْتُوا بِآبَائِنَا إِنْ كُنْتُمْ صَادِقِينَ
occurrences.english_translation: And when Our Clear Signs are rehearsed to them their argument is nothing but this: They say, "Bring (back) our forefathers, if what ye say is true!"

occurrences.arabic_text: كُلُّ أُمَّةٍ تُدْعَىٰ إِلَىٰ كِتَابِهَا الْيَوْمَ تُجْزَوْنَ مَا كُنْتُمْ تَعْمَلُونَ
occurrences.english_translation: And thou wilt see every sect bowing the knee: Every sect will be called to its Record: "This Day shall ye be recompensed for all that ye did!

occurrences.arabic_text: هَٰذَا كِتَابُنَا يَنْطِقُ عَلَيْكُمْ بِالْحَقِّ إِنَّا كُنَّا نَسْتَنْسِخُ مَا كُنْتُمْ تَعْمَلُونَ
occurrences.english_translation: "This Our Record speaks about you with truth: For We were wont to put on Record all that ye did."

occurrences.arabic_text: إِنَّا كُنَّا نَسْتَنْسِخُ مَا كُنْتُمْ تَعْمَلُونَ
occurrences.english_translation: "This Our Record speaks about you with truth: For We were wont to put on Record all that ye did."

occurrences.arabic_text: أَفَلَمْ تَكُنْ آيَاتِي تُتْلَىٰ عَلَيْكُمْ فَاسْتَكْبَرْتُمْ وَكُنْتُمْ قَوْمًا مُجْرِمِينَ
occurrences.english_translation: But as to those who rejected Allah, (to them will be said): "Were not Our Signs rehearsed to you? But ye were arrogant, and were a people given to sin!

occurrences.arabic_text: أَفَلَمْ تَكُنْ آيَاتِي تُتْلَىٰ عَلَيْكُمْ فَاسْتَكْبَرْتُمْ وَكُنْتُمْ قَوْمًا مُجْرِمِينَ
occurrences.english_translation: But as to those who rejected Allah, (to them will be said): "Were not Our Signs rehearsed to you? But ye were arrogant, and were a people given to sin!

occurrences.arabic_text: وَبَدَا لَهُمْ سَيِّئَاتُ مَا عَمِلُوا وَحَاقَ بِهِمْ مَا كَانُوا بِهِ يَسْتَهْزِئُونَ
occurrences.english_translation: Then will appear to them the evil (fruits) of what they did, and they will be completely encircled by that which they used to mock at!

occurrences.arabic_text: ائْتُونِي بِكِتَابٍ مِنْ قَبْلِ هَٰذَا أَوْ أَثَارَةٍ مِنْ عِلْمٍ إِنْ كُنْتُمْ صَادِقِينَ
occurrences.english_translation: Say: "Do ye see what it is ye invoke besides Allah? Show me what it is they have created on earth, or have they a share in the heavens bring me a book (revealed) before this, or any remnant of knowledge (ye may have), if ye are telling the truth!

occurrences.arabic_text: وَإِذَا حُشِرَ النَّاسُ كَانُوا لَهُمْ أَعْدَاءً
occurrences.english_translation: And when mankind are gathered together (at the Resurrection), they will be hostile to them and reject their worship (altogether)!

occurrences.arabic_text: وَكَانُوا بِعِبَادَتِهِمْ كَافِرِينَ
occurrences.english_translation: And when mankind are gathered together (at the Resurrection), they will be hostile to them and reject their worship (altogether)!

occurrences.arabic_text: قُلْ مَا كُنْتُ بِدْعًا مِنَ الرُّسُلِ وَمَا أَدْرِي مَا يُفْعَلُ بِي وَلَا بِكُمْ
occurrences.english_translation: Say: "I am no bringer of new-fangled doctrine among the messengers, nor do I know what will be done with me or with you. I follow but that which is revealed to me by inspiration; I am but a Warner open and clear."

occurrences.arabic_text: قُلْ أَرَأَيْتُمْ إِنْ كَانَ مِنْ عِنْدِ اللَّهِ وَكَفَرْتُمْ بِهِ
occurrences.english_translation: Say: "See ye? If (this teaching) be from Allah, and ye reject it, and a witness from among the Children of Israel testifies to its similarity (with earlier scripture), and has believed while ye are arrogant, (how unjust ye are!) truly, Allah guides not a people unjust."

occurrences.arabic_text: وَقَالَ الَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا لِلَّذِينَ آمَنُوا لَوْ كَانَ خَيْرًا مَا سَبَقُونَا إِلَيْهِ
occurrences.english_translation: The Unbelievers say of those who believe: "If (this Message) were a good thing, (such men) would not have gone to it first, before us!" And seeing that they guide not themselves thereby, they will say, "this is an (old,) falsehood!"

occurrences.arabic_text: أُولَٰئِكَ أَصْحَابُ الْجَنَّةِ خَالِدِينَ فِيهَا جَزَاءً بِمَا كَانُوا يَعْمَلُونَ
occurrences.english_translation: Such shall be Companions of the Gardens, dwelling therein (for aye): a recompense for their (good) deeds.

occurrences.arabic_text: وَعْدَ الصِّدْقِ الَّذِي كَانُوا يُوعَدُونَ
occurrences.english_translation: Such are they from whom We shall accept the best of their deeds and pass by their ill deeds: (They shall be) among the Companions of the Garden: a promise! of truth, which was made to them (in this life).

occurrences.arabic_text: قَدْ خَلَتْ مِنْ قَبْلِهِمْ مِنَ الْجِنِّ وَالْإِنْسِ إِنَّهُمْ كَانُوا خَاسِرِينَ
occurrences.english_translation: Such are they against whom is proved the sentence among the previous generations of Jinns and men, that have passed away; for they will be (utterly) lost.

occurrences.arabic_text: فَالْيَوْمَ تُجْزَوْنَ عَذَابَ الْهُونِ بِمَا كُنْتُمْ تَسْتَكْبِرُونَ فِي الْأَرْضِ بِغَيْرِ الْحَقِّ
occurrences.english_translation: And on the Day that the Unbelievers will be placed before the Fire, (It will be said to them): "Ye received your good things in the life of the world, and ye took your pleasure out of them: but today shall ye be recompensed with a Penalty of humiliation: for that ye were arrogant on earth without just cause, and that ye (ever) transgressed."

occurrences.arabic_text: وَبِمَا كُنْتُمْ تَفْسُقُونَ
occurrences.english_translation: And on the Day that the Unbelievers will be placed before the Fire, (It will be said to them): "Ye received your good things in the life of the world, and ye took your pleasure out of them: but today shall ye be recompensed with a Penalty of humiliation: for that ye were arrogant on earth without just cause, and that ye (ever) transgressed."

occurrences.arabic_text: فَأْتِنَا بِمَا تَعِدُنَا إِنْ كُنْتَ مِنَ الصَّادِقِينَ
occurrences.english_translation: They said: "Hast thou come in order to turn us aside from our gods? Then bring upon us the (calamity) with which thou dost threaten us, if thou art telling the truth?"

occurrences.arabic_text: فَمَا أَغْنَىٰ عَنْهُمْ سَمْعُهُمْ وَلَا أَبْصَارُهُمْ وَلَا أَفْئِدَتُهُمْ مِنْ شَيْءٍ إِذْ كَانُوا يَجْحَدُونَ بِآيَاتِ اللَّهِ
occurrences.english_translation: And We had firmly established them in a (prosperity and) power which We have not given to you (ye Quraish!) and We had endowed them with (faculties of) hearing, seeing, heart and intellect: but of no profit to them were their (faculties of) hearing, sight, and heart and intellect, when they went on rejecting the Signs of Allah; and they were (completely) encircled by that which they used to mock at!

occurrences.arabic_text: وَحَاقَ بِهِمْ مَا كَانُوا بِهِ يَسْتَهْزِئُونَ
occurrences.english_translation: And We had firmly established them in a (prosperity and) power which We have not given to you (ye Quraish!) and We had endowed them with (faculties of) hearing, seeing, heart and intellect: but of no profit to them were their (faculties of) hearing, sight, and heart and intellect, when they went on rejecting the Signs of Allah; and they were (completely) encircled by that which they used to mock at!

occurrences.arabic_text: وَذَٰلِكَ إِفْكُهُمْ وَمَا كَانُوا يَفْتَرُونَ
occurrences.english_translation: Why then was no help forthcoming to them from those whom they worshipped as gods, besides Allah, as a means of access (to Allah)? Nay, they left them in the lurch: but that was their falsehood and their invention.

occurrences.arabic_text: قَالُوا بَلَىٰ وَرَبِّنَا قَالَ فَذُوقُوا الْعَذَابَ بِمَا كُنْتُمْ تَكْفُرُونَ
occurrences.english_translation: And on the Day that the Unbelievers will be placed before the Fire, (they will be asked,) "Is this not the Truth?" they will say, "Yea, by our Lord!" (One will say:) "Then taste ye the Penalty, for that ye were wont to deny (Truth)!"

occurrences.arabic_text: فَيَنْظُرُوا كَيْفَ كَانَ عَاقِبَةُ الَّذِينَ مِنْ قَبْلِهِمْ
occurrences.english_translation: Do they not travel through the earth, and see what was the End of those before them (who did evil)? Allah brought utter destruction on them, and similar (fates await) those who reject Allah.

occurrences.arabic_text: أَفَمَنْ كَانَ عَلَىٰ بَيِّنَةٍ مِنْ رَبِّهِ كَمَنْ زُيِّنَ لَهُ سُوءُ عَمَلِهِ
occurrences.english_translation: Is then one who is on a clear (Path) from his Lord, no better than one to whom the evil of his conduct seems pleasing, and such as follow their own lusts?

occurrences.arabic_text: فَإِذَا عَزَمَ الْأَمْرُ فَلَوْ صَدَقُوا اللَّهَ لَكَانَ خَيْرًا لَهُمْ
occurrences.english_translation: Were it to obey and say what is just, and when a matter is resolved on, it were best for them if they were true to Allah.

occurrences.arabic_text: وَإِنْ تَتَوَلَّوْا يَسْتَبْدِلْ قَوْمًا غَيْرَكُمْ ثُمَّ لَا يَكُونُوا أَمْثَالَكُمْ
occurrences.english_translation: Behold, ye are those invited to spend (of your substance) in the Way of Allah: But among you are some that are niggardly. But any who are niggardly are so at the expense of their own souls. But Allah is free of all wants, and it is ye that are needy. If ye turn back (from the Path), He will substitute in your stead another people; then they would not be like you!

occurrences.arabic_text: وَلِلَّهِ جُنُودُ السَّمَاوَاتِ وَالْأَرْضِ وَكَانَ اللَّهُ عَلِيمًا حَكِيمًا
occurrences.english_translation: It is He Who sent down tranquillity into the hearts of the Believers, that they may add faith to their faith;- for to Allah belong the Forces of the heavens and the earth; and Allah is Full of Knowledge and Wisdom;-

occurrences.arabic_text: وَيُكَفِّرَ عَنْهُمْ سَيِّئَاتِهِمْ وَكَانَ ذَٰلِكَ عِنْدَ اللَّهِ فَوْزًا عَظِيمًا
occurrences.english_translation: That He may admit the men and women who believe, to Gardens beneath which rivers flow, to dwell therein for aye, and remove their ills from them;- and that is, in the sight of Allah, the highest achievement (for man),-

occurrences.arabic_text: وَلِلَّهِ جُنُودُ السَّمَاوَاتِ وَالْأَرْضِ وَكَانَ اللَّهُ عَزِيزًا حَكِيمًا
occurrences.english_translation: For to Allah belong the Forces of the heavens and the earth; and Allah is Exalted in Power, Full of Wisdom.

occurrences.arabic_text: بَلْ كَانَ اللَّهُ بِمَا تَعْمَلُونَ خَبِيرًا
occurrences.english_translation: The desert Arabs who lagged behind will say to thee: "We were engaged in (looking after) our flocks and herds, and our families: do thou then ask forgiveness for us." They say with their tongues what is not in their hearts. Say: "Who then has any power at all (to intervene) on your behalf with Allah, if His Will is to give you some loss or to give you some profit? But Allah is well acquainted with all that ye do.

occurrences.arabic_text: وَظَنَنْتُمْ ظَنَّ السَّوْءِ وَكُنْتُمْ قَوْمًا بُورًا
occurrences.english_translation: "Nay, ye thought that the Messenger and the Believers would never return to their families; this seemed pleasing in your hearts, and ye conceived an evil thought, for ye are a people lost (in wickedness)."

occurrences.arabic_text: يَغْفِرُ لِمَنْ يَشَاءُ وَيُعَذِّبُ مَنْ يَشَاءُ وَكَانَ اللَّهُ غَفُورًا رَحِيمًا
occurrences.english_translation: To Allah belongs the dominion of the heavens and the earth: He forgives whom He wills, and He punishes whom He wills: but Allah is Oft-Forgiving, Most Merciful.

occurrences.arabic_text: فَسَيَقُولُونَ بَلْ تَحْسُدُونَنَا بَلْ كَانُوا لَا يَفْقَهُونَ إِلَّا قَلِيلًا
occurrences.english_translation: Those who lagged behind (will say), when ye (are free to) march and take booty (in war): "Permit us to follow you." They wish to change Allah's decree: Say: "Not thus will ye follow us: Allah has already declared (this) beforehand": then they will say, "But ye are jealous of us." Nay, but little do they understand (such things).

occurrences.arabic_text: وَمَغَانِمَ كَثِيرَةً يَأْخُذُونَهَا وَكَانَ اللَّهُ عَزِيزًا حَكِيمًا
occurrences.english_translation: And many gains will they acquire (besides): and Allah is Exalted in Power, Full of Wisdom.

occurrences.arabic_text: وَلِتَكُونَ آيَةً لِلْمُؤْمِنِينَ وَيَهْدِيَكُمْ صِرَاطًا مُسْتَقِيمًا
occurrences.english_translation: Allah has promised you many gains that ye shall acquire, and He has given you these beforehand; and He has restrained the hands of men from you; that it may be a Sign for the Believers, and that He may guide you to a Straight Path;

occurrences.arabic_text: قَدْ أَحَاطَ اللَّهُ بِهَا وَكَانَ اللَّهُ عَلَىٰ كُلِّ شَيْءٍ قَدِيرًا
occurrences.english_translation: And other gains (there are), which are not within your power, but which Allah has compassed: and Allah has power over all things.

occurrences.arabic_text: مِنْ بَعْدِ أَنْ أَظْفَرَكُمْ عَلَيْهِمْ وَكَانَ اللَّهُ بِمَا تَعْمَلُونَ بَصِيرًا
occurrences.english_translation: And it is He Who has restrained their hands from you and your hands from them in the midst of Makka, after that He gave you the victory over them. And Allah sees well all that ye do.

occurrences.arabic_text: وَأَلْزَمَهُمْ كَلِمَةَ التَّقْوَىٰ وَكَانُوا أَحَقَّ بِهَا وَأَهْلَهَا
occurrences.english_translation: While the Unbelievers got up in their hearts heat and cant - the heat and cant of ignorance,- Allah sent down His Tranquillity to his Messenger and to the Believers, and made them stick close to the command of self-restraint; and well were they entitled to it and worthy of it. And Allah has full knowledge of all things.

occurrences.arabic_text: وَكَانُوا أَحَقَّ بِهَا وَأَهْلَهَا وَكَانَ اللَّهُ بِكُلِّ شَيْءٍ عَلِيمًا
occurrences.english_translation: While the Unbelievers got up in their hearts heat and cant - the heat and cant of ignorance,- Allah sent down His Tranquillity to his Messenger and to the Believers, and made them stick close to the command of self-restraint; and well were they entitled to it and worthy of it. And Allah has full knowledge of all things.

occurrences.arabic_text: وَلَوْ أَنَّهُمْ صَبَرُوا حَتَّىٰ تَخْرُجَ إِلَيْهِمْ لَكَانَ خَيْرًا لَهُمْ
occurrences.english_translation: If only they had patience until thou couldst come out to them, it would be best for them: but Allah is Oft-Forgiving, Most Merciful.

occurrences.arabic_text: لَا يَسْخَرْ قَوْمٌ مِنْ قَوْمٍ عَسَىٰ أَنْ يَكُونُوا خَيْرًا مِنْهُمْ
occurrences.english_translation: O ye who believe! Let not some men among you laugh at others: It may be that the (latter) are better than the (former): Nor let some women laugh at others: It may be that the (latter are better than the (former): Nor defame nor be sarcastic to each other, nor call each other by (offensive) nicknames: Ill-seeming is a name connoting wickedness, (to be used of one) after he has believed: And those who do not desist are (indeed) doing wrong.

occurrences.arabic_text: وَلَا نِسَاءٌ مِنْ نِسَاءٍ عَسَىٰ أَنْ يَكُنَّ خَيْرًا مِنْهُنَّ
occurrences.english_translation: O ye who believe! Let not some men among you laugh at others: It may be that the (latter) are better than the (former): Nor let some women laugh at others: It may be that the (latter are better than the (former): Nor defame nor be sarcastic to each other, nor call each other by (offensive) nicknames: Ill-seeming is a name connoting wickedness, (to be used of one) after he has believed: And those who do not desist are (indeed) doing wrong.

occurrences.arabic_text: بَلِ اللَّهُ يَمُنُّ عَلَيْكُمْ أَنْ هَدَاكُمْ لِلْإِيمَانِ إِنْ كُنْتُمْ صَادِقِينَ
occurrences.english_translation: They impress on thee as a favour that they have embraced Islam. Say, "Count not your Islam as a favour upon me: Nay, Allah has conferred a favour upon you that He has guided you to the faith, if ye be true and sincere.

occurrences.arabic_text: أَإِذَا مِتْنَا وَكُنَّا تُرَابًا ذَٰلِكَ رَجْعٌ بَعِيدٌ
occurrences.english_translation: "What! When we die and become dust, (shall we live again?) That is a (sort of) return far (from our understanding)."

occurrences.arabic_text: وَجَاءَتْ سَكْرَةُ الْمَوْتِ بِالْحَقِّ ذَٰلِكَ مَا كُنْتَ مِنْهُ تَحِيدُ
occurrences.english_translation: And the stupor of death will bring Truth (before his eyes): "This was the thing which thou wast trying to escape!"

occurrences.arabic_text: لَقَدْ كُنْتَ فِي غَفْلَةٍ مِنْ هَٰذَا فَكَشَفْنَا عَنْكَ غِطَاءَكَ
occurrences.english_translation: (It will be said:) "Thou wast heedless of this; now have We removed thy veil, and sharp is thy sight this Day!"

occurrences.arabic_text: قَالَ قَرِينُهُ رَبَّنَا مَا أَطْغَيْتُهُ وَلَٰكِنْ كَانَ فِي ضَلَالٍ بَعِيدٍ
occurrences.english_translation: His Companion will say: "Our Lord! I did not make him transgress, but he was (himself) far astray."

occurrences.arabic_text: إِنَّ فِي ذَٰلِكَ لَذِكْرَىٰ لِمَنْ كَانَ لَهُ قَلْبٌ أَوْ أَلْقَى السَّمْعَ وَهُوَ شَهِيدٌ
occurrences.english_translation: Verily in this is a Message for any that has a heart and understanding or who gives ear and earnestly witnesses (the truth).

occurrences.arabic_text: ذُوقُوا فِتْنَتَكُمْ هَٰذَا الَّذِي كُنْتُمْ بِهِ تَسْتَعْجِلُونَ
occurrences.english_translation: "Taste ye your trial! This is what ye used to ask to be hastened!"

occurrences.arabic_text: إِنَّهُمْ كَانُوا قَبْلَ ذَٰلِكَ مُحْسِنِينَ
occurrences.english_translation: Taking joy in the things which their Lord gives them, because, before then, they lived a good life.

occurrences.arabic_text: كَانُوا قَلِيلًا مِنَ اللَّيْلِ مَا يَهْجَعُونَ
occurrences.english_translation: They were in the habit of sleeping but little by night,

occurrences.arabic_text: فَأَخْرَجْنَا مَنْ كَانَ فِيهَا مِنَ الْمُؤْمِنِينَ
occurrences.english_translation: Then We evacuated those of the Believers who were there,

occurrences.arabic_text: فَمَا اسْتَطَاعُوا مِنْ قِيَامٍ وَمَا كَانُوا مُنْتَصِرِينَ
occurrences.english_translation: Then they could not even stand (on their feet), nor could they help themselves.

occurrences.arabic_text: وَقَوْمَ نُوحٍ مِنْ قَبْلُ إِنَّهُمْ كَانُوا قَوْمًا فَاسِقِينَ
occurrences.english_translation: So were the People of Noah before them for they wickedly transgressed.

occurrences.arabic_text: هَٰذِهِ النَّارُ الَّتِي كُنْتُمْ بِهَا تُكَذِّبُونَ
occurrences.english_translation: "This:, it will be said, "Is the Fire,- which ye were wont to deny!

occurrences.arabic_text: إِنَّمَا تُجْزَوْنَ مَا كُنْتُمْ تَعْمَلُونَ
occurrences.english_translation: "Burn ye therein: the same is it to you whether ye bear it with patience, or not: Ye but receive the recompense of your (own) deeds."

occurrences.arabic_text: كُلُوا وَاشْرَبُوا هَنِيئًا بِمَا كُنْتُمْ تَعْمَلُونَ
occurrences.english_translation: (To them will be said:) "Eat and drink ye, with profit and health, because of your (good) deeds."

occurrences.arabic_text: قَالُوا إِنَّا كُنَّا قَبْلُ فِي أَهْلِنَا مُشْفِقِينَ
occurrences.english_translation: They will say: "Aforetime, we were not without fear for the sake of our people.

occurrences.arabic_text: إِنَّا كُنَّا مِنْ قَبْلُ نَدْعُوهُ إِنَّهُ هُوَ الْبَرُّ الرَّحِيمُ
occurrences.english_translation: "Truly, we did call unto Him from of old: truly it is He, the Beneficent, the Merciful!"

occurrences.arabic_text: فَلْيَأْتُوا بِحَدِيثٍ مِثْلِهِ إِنْ كَانُوا صَادِقِينَ
occurrences.english_translation: Let them then produce a recital like unto it,- If (it be) they speak the truth!

occurrences.arabic_text: فَكَانَ قَابَ قَوْسَيْنِ أَوْ أَدْنَىٰ
occurrences.english_translation: And was at a distance of but two bow-lengths or (even) nearer;

occurrences.arabic_text: وَقَوْمَ نُوحٍ مِنْ قَبْلُ إِنَّهُمْ كَانُوا هُمْ أَظْلَمَ وَأَطْغَىٰ
occurrences.english_translation: And before them, the people of Noah, for that they were (all) most unjust and most insolent transgressors,

occurrences.arabic_text: تَجْرِي بِأَعْيُنِنَا جَزَاءً لِمَنْ كَانَ كُفِرَ
occurrences.english_translation: She floats under our eyes (and care): a recompense to one who had been rejected (with scorn)!

occurrences.arabic_text: فَكَيْفَ كَانَ عَذَابِي وَنُذُرِ
occurrences.english_translation: But how (terrible) was My Penalty and My Warning?

occurrences.arabic_text: كَذَّبَتْ عَادٌ فَكَيْفَ كَانَ عَذَابِي وَنُذُرِ
occurrences.english_translation: The 'Ad (people) (too) rejected (Truth): then how terrible was My Penalty and My Warning?

occurrences.arabic_text: فَكَيْفَ كَانَ عَذَابِي وَنُذُرِ
occurrences.english_translation: Yea, how (terrible) was My Penalty and My Warning!

occurrences.arabic_text: فَكَيْفَ كَانَ عَذَابِي وَنُذُرِ
occurrences.english_translation: Ah! how (terrible) was My Penalty and My Warning!

occurrences.arabic_text: إِنَّا أَرْسَلْنَا عَلَيْهِمْ صَيْحَةً وَاحِدَةً فَكَانُوا كَهَشِيمِ الْمُحْتَظِرِ
occurrences.english_translation: For We sent against them a single Mighty Blast, and they became like the dry stubble used by one who pens cattle.

occurrences.arabic_text: فَإِذَا انْشَقَّتِ السَّمَاءُ فَكَانَتْ وَرْدَةً كَالدِّهَانِ
occurrences.english_translation: When the sky is rent asunder, and it becomes red like ointment:

occurrences.arabic_text: فَكَانَتْ هَبَاءً مُنْبَثًّا
occurrences.english_translation: Becoming dust scattered abroad,

occurrences.arabic_text: وَكُنْتُمْ أَزْوَاجًا ثَلَاثَةً
occurrences.english_translation: And ye shall be sorted out into three classes.

occurrences.arabic_text: جَزَاءً بِمَا كَانُوا يَعْمَلُونَ
occurrences.english_translation: A Reward for the deeds of their past (life).

occurrences.arabic_text: إِنَّهُمْ كَانُوا قَبْلَ ذَٰلِكَ مُتْرَفِينَ
occurrences.english_translation: For that they were wont to be indulged, before that, in wealth (and luxury),

occurrences.arabic_text: وَكَانُوا يُصِرُّونَ عَلَى الْحِنْثِ الْعَظِيمِ
occurrences.english_translation: And persisted obstinately in wickedness supreme!

occurrences.arabic_text: وَكَانُوا يَقُولُونَ أَئِذَا مِتْنَا وَكُنَّا تُرَابًا وَعِظَامًا أَإِنَّا لَمَبْعُوثُونَ
occurrences.english_translation: And they used to say, "What! when we die and become dust and bones, shall we then indeed be raised up again?-

occurrences.arabic_text: وَكَانُوا يَقُولُونَ أَئِذَا مِتْنَا وَكُنَّا تُرَابًا وَعِظَامًا أَإِنَّا لَمَبْعُوثُونَ
occurrences.english_translation: And they used to say, "What! when we die and become dust and bones, shall we then indeed be raised up again?-

occurrences.arabic_text: فَلَوْلَا إِنْ كُنْتُمْ غَيْرَ مَدِينِينَ
occurrences.english_translation: Then why do ye not,- If you are exempt from (future) account,-

occurrences.arabic_text: تَرْجِعُونَهَا إِنْ كُنْتُمْ صَادِقِينَ
occurrences.english_translation: Call back the soul, if ye are true (in the claim of independence)?

occurrences.arabic_text: فَأَمَّا إِنْ كَانَ مِنَ الْمُقَرَّبِينَ
occurrences.english_translation: Thus, then, if he be of those Nearest to Allah,

occurrences.arabic_text: وَأَمَّا إِنْ كَانَ مِنْ أَصْحَابِ الْيَمِينِ
occurrences.english_translation: And if he be of the Companions of the Right Hand,

occurrences.arabic_text: وَأَمَّا إِنْ كَانَ مِنَ الْمُكَذِّبِينَ الضَّالِّينَ
occurrences.english_translation: And if he be of those who treat (Truth) as Falsehood, who go wrong,

occurrences.arabic_text: وَهُوَ مَعَكُمْ أَيْنَ مَا كُنْتُمْ وَاللَّهُ بِمَا تَعْمَلُونَ بَصِيرٌ
occurrences.english_translation: He it is Who created the heavens and the earth in Six Days, and is moreover firmly established on the Throne (of Authority). He knows what enters within the earth and what comes forth out of it, what comes down from heaven and what mounts up to it. And He is with you wheresoever ye may be. And Allah sees well all that ye do.

occurrences.arabic_text: وَقَدْ أَخَذَ مِيثَاقَكُمْ إِنْ كُنْتُمْ مُؤْمِنِينَ
occurrences.english_translation: What cause have ye why ye should not believe in Allah?- and the Messenger invites you to believe in your Lord, and has indeed taken your Covenant, if ye are men of Faith.

occurrences.arabic_text: يُنَادُونَهُمْ أَلَمْ نَكُنْ مَعَكُمْ
occurrences.english_translation: (Those without) will call out, "Were we not with you?" (The others) will reply, "True! but ye led yourselves into temptation; ye looked forward (to our ruin); ye doubted (Allah's Promise); and (your false) desires deceived you; until there issued the Command of Allah. And the Deceiver deceived you in respect of Allah.

occurrences.arabic_text: وَلَا يَكُونُوا كَالَّذِينَ أُوتُوا الْكِتَابَ مِنْ قَبْلُ
occurrences.english_translation: Has not the Time arrived for the Believers that their hearts in all humility should engage in the remembrance of Allah and of the Truth which has been revealed (to them), and that they should not become like those to whom was given Revelation aforetime, but long ages passed over them and their hearts grew hard? For many among them are rebellious transgressors.

occurrences.arabic_text: ثُمَّ يَهِيجُ فَتَرَاهُ مُصْفَرًّا ثُمَّ يَكُونُ حُطَامًا
occurrences.english_translation: Know ye (all), that the life of this world is but play and amusement, pomp and mutual boasting and multiplying, (in rivalry) among yourselves, riches and children. Here is a similitude: How rain and the growth which it brings forth, delight (the hearts of) the tillers; soon it withers; thou wilt see it grow yellow; then it becomes dry and crumbles away. But in the Hereafter is a Penalty severe (for the devotees of wrong). And Forgiveness from Allah and (His) Good Pleasure (for the devotees of Allah). And what is the life of this world, but goods and chattels of deception?

occurrences.arabic_text: مَا يَكُونُ مِنْ نَجْوَىٰ ثَلَاثَةٍ إِلَّا هُوَ رَابِعُهُمْ
occurrences.english_translation: Seest thou not that Allah doth know (all) that is in the heavens and on earth? There is not a secret consultation between three, but He makes the fourth among them, - Nor between five but He makes the sixth,- nor between fewer nor more, but He is in their midst, wheresoever they be: In the end will He tell them the truth of their conduct, on the Day of Judgment. For Allah has full knowledge of all things.

occurrences.arabic_text: وَلَا أَدْنَىٰ مِنْ ذَٰلِكَ وَلَا أَكْثَرَ إِلَّا هُوَ مَعَهُمْ أَيْنَ مَا كَانُوا
occurrences.english_translation: Seest thou not that Allah doth know (all) that is in the heavens and on earth? There is not a secret consultation between three, but He makes the fourth among them, - Nor between five but He makes the sixth,- nor between fewer nor more, but He is in their midst, wheresoever they be: In the end will He tell them the truth of their conduct, on the Day of Judgment. For Allah has full knowledge of all things.

occurrences.arabic_text: أَعَدَّ اللَّهُ لَهُمْ عَذَابًا شَدِيدًا إِنَّهُمْ سَاءَ مَا كَانُوا يَعْمَلُونَ
occurrences.english_translation: Allah has prepared for them a severe Penalty: evil indeed are their deeds.

occurrences.arabic_text: لَا تَجِدُ قَوْمًا يُؤْمِنُونَ بِاللَّهِ وَالْيَوْمِ الْآخِرِ يُوَادُّونَ مَنْ حَادَّ اللَّهَ وَرَسُولَهُ وَلَوْ كَانُوا آبَاءَهُمْ أَوْ أَبْنَاءَهُمْ
occurrences.english_translation: Thou wilt not find any people who believe in Allah and the Last Day, loving those who resist Allah and His Messenger, even though they were their fathers or their sons, or their brothers, or their kindred. For such He has written Faith in their hearts, and strengthened them with a spirit from Himself. And He will admit them to Gardens beneath which Rivers flow, to dwell therein (for ever). Allah will be well pleased with them, and they with Him. They are the Party of Allah. Truly it is the Party of Allah that will achieve Felicity.

occurrences.arabic_text: كَيْ لَا يَكُونَ دُولَةً بَيْنَ الْأَغْنِيَاءِ مِنْكُمْ
occurrences.english_translation: What Allah has bestowed on His Messenger (and taken away) from the people of the townships,- belongs to Allah,- to His Messenger and to kindred and orphans, the needy and the wayfarer; In order that it may not (merely) make a circuit between the wealthy among you. So take what the Messenger assigns to you, and deny yourselves that which he withholds from you. And fear Allah; for Allah is strict in Punishment.

occurrences.arabic_text: وَيُؤْثِرُونَ عَلَىٰ أَنْفُسِهِمْ وَلَوْ كَانَ بِهِمْ خَصَاصَةٌ
occurrences.english_translation: But those who before them, had homes (in Medina) and had adopted the Faith,- show their affection to such as came to them for refuge, and entertain no desire in their hearts for things given to the (latter), but give them preference over themselves, even though poverty was their (own lot). And those saved from the covetousness of their own souls,- they are the ones that achieve prosperity.

occurrences.arabic_text: فَكَانَ عَاقِبَتَهُمَا أَنَّهُمَا فِي النَّارِ خَالِدَيْنِ فِيهَا
occurrences.english_translation: The end of both will be that they will go into the Fire, dwelling therein for ever. Such is the reward of the wrong-doers.

occurrences.arabic_text: وَلَا تَكُونُوا كَالَّذِينَ نَسُوا اللَّهَ فَأَنْسَاهُمْ أَنْفُسَهُمْ
occurrences.english_translation: And be ye not like those who forgot Allah; and He made them forget their own souls! Such are the rebellious transgressors!

occurrences.arabic_text: إِنْ كُنْتُمْ خَرَجْتُمْ جِهَادًا فِي سَبِيلِي وَابْتِغَاءَ مَرْضَاتِي
occurrences.english_translation: O ye who believe! Take not my enemies and yours as friends (or protectors),- offering them (your) love, even though they have rejected the Truth that has come to you, and have (on the contrary) driven out the Prophet and yourselves (from your homes), (simply) because ye believe in Allah your Lord! If ye have come out to strive in My Way and to seek My Good Pleasure, (take them not as friends), holding secret converse of love (and friendship) with them: for I know full well all that ye conceal and all that ye reveal. And any of you that does this has strayed from the Straight Path.

occurrences.arabic_text: إِنْ يَثْقَفُوكُمْ يَكُونُوا لَكُمْ أَعْدَاءً وَيَبْسُطُوا إِلَيْكُمْ أَيْدِيَهُمْ
occurrences.english_translation: If they were to get the better of you, they would behave to you as enemies, and stretch forth their hands and their tongues against you for evil: and they desire that ye should reject the Truth.

occurrences.arabic_text: قَدْ كَانَتْ لَكُمْ أُسْوَةٌ حَسَنَةٌ فِي إِبْرَاهِيمَ وَالَّذِينَ مَعَهُ
occurrences.english_translation: There is for you an excellent example (to follow) in Abraham and those with him, when they said to their people: "We are clear of you and of whatever ye worship besides Allah: we have rejected you, and there has arisen, between us and you, enmity and hatred for ever,- unless ye believe in Allah and Him alone": But not when Abraham said to his father: "I will pray for forgiveness for thee, though I have no power (to get) aught on thy behalf from Allah." (They prayed): "Our Lord! in Thee do we trust, and to Thee do we turn in repentance: to Thee is (our) Final Goal.

occurrences.arabic_text: لَقَدْ كَانَ لَكُمْ فِيهِمْ أُسْوَةٌ حَسَنَةٌ
occurrences.english_translation: There was indeed in them an excellent example for you to follow,- for those whose hope is in Allah and in the Last Day. But if any turn away, truly Allah is Free of all Wants, Worthy of all Praise.

occurrences.arabic_text: لِمَنْ كَانَ يَرْجُو اللَّهَ وَالْيَوْمَ الْآخِرَ
occurrences.english_translation: There was indeed in them an excellent example for you to follow,- for those whose hope is in Allah and in the Last Day. But if any turn away, truly Allah is Free of all Wants, Worthy of all Praise.

occurrences.arabic_text: ذَٰلِكُمْ خَيْرٌ لَكُمْ إِنْ كُنْتُمْ تَعْلَمُونَ
occurrences.english_translation: That ye believe in Allah and His Messenger, and that ye strive (your utmost) in the Cause of Allah, with your property and your persons: That will be best for you, if ye but knew!

occurrences.arabic_text: يَا أَيُّهَا الَّذِينَ آمَنُوا كُونُوا أَنْصَارَ اللَّهِ
occurrences.english_translation: O ye who believe! Be ye helpers of Allah: As said Jesus the son of Mary to the Disciples, "Who will be my helpers to (the work of) Allah?" Said the disciples, "We are Allah's helpers!" then a portion of the Children of Israel believed, and a portion disbelieved: But We gave power to those who believed, against their enemies, and they became the ones that prevailed.

occurrences.arabic_text: وَإِنْ كَانُوا مِنْ قَبْلُ لَفِي ضَلَالٍ مُبِينٍ
occurrences.english_translation: It is He Who has sent amongst the Unlettered a messenger from among themselves, to rehearse to them His Signs, to sanctify them, and to instruct them in Scripture and Wisdom,- although they had been, before, in manifest error;-

occurrences.arabic_text: فَتَمَنَّوُا الْمَوْتَ إِنْ كُنْتُمْ صَادِقِينَ
occurrences.english_translation: Say: "O ye that stand on Judaism! If ye think that ye are friends to Allah, to the exclusion of (other) men, then express your desire for Death, if ye are truthful!"

occurrences.arabic_text: ثُمَّ تُرَدُّونَ إِلَىٰ عَالِمِ الْغَيْبِ وَالشَّهَادَةِ فَيُنَبِّئُكُمْ بِمَا كُنْتُمْ تَعْمَلُونَ
occurrences.english_translation: Say: "The Death from which ye flee will truly overtake you: then will ye be sent back to the Knower of things secret and open: and He will tell you (the truth of) the things that ye did!"

occurrences.arabic_text: ذَٰلِكُمْ خَيْرٌ لَكُمْ إِنْ كُنْتُمْ تَعْلَمُونَ
occurrences.english_translation: O ye who believe! When the call is proclaimed to prayer on Friday (the Day of Assembly), hasten earnestly to the Remembrance of Allah, and leave off business (and traffic): That is best for you if ye but knew!

occurrences.arabic_text: فَصَدُّوا عَنْ سَبِيلِ اللَّهِ إِنَّهُمْ سَاءَ مَا كَانُوا يَعْمَلُونَ
occurrences.english_translation: They have made their oaths a screen (for their misdeeds): thus they obstruct (men) from the Path of Allah: truly evil are their deeds.

occurrences.arabic_text: رَبِّ لَوْلَا أَخَّرْتَنِي إِلَىٰ أَجَلٍ قَرِيبٍ فَأَصَّدَّقَ وَأَكُنْ مِنَ الصَّالِحِينَ
occurrences.english_translation: and spend something (in charity) out of the substance which We have bestowed on you, before Death should come to any of you and he should say, "O my Lord! why didst Thou not give me respite for a little while? I should then have given (largely) in charity, and I should have been one of the doers of good".

occurrences.arabic_text: ذَٰلِكَ بِأَنَّهُ كَانَتْ تَأْتِيهِمْ رُسُلُهُمْ بِالْبَيِّنَاتِ
occurrences.english_translation: That was because there came to them messengers with Clear Signs, but they said: "Shall (mere) human beings direct us?" So they rejected (the Message) and turned away. But Allah can do without (them): and Allah is free of all needs, worthy of all praise.

occurrences.arabic_text: ذَٰلِكُمْ يُوعَظُ بِهِ مَنْ كَانَ يُؤْمِنُ بِاللَّهِ وَالْيَوْمِ الْآخِرِ
occurrences.english_translation: Thus when they fulfil their term appointed, either take them back on equitable terms or part with them on equitable terms; and take for witness two persons from among you, endued with justice, and establish the evidence (as) before Allah. Such is the admonition given to him who believes in Allah and the Last Day. And for those who fear Allah, He (ever) prepares a way out,

occurrences.arabic_text: وَإِنْ كُنَّ أُولَاتِ حَمْلٍ فَأَنْفِقُوا عَلَيْهِنَّ حَتَّىٰ يَضَعْنَ حَمْلَهُنَّ
occurrences.english_translation: Let the women live (in 'iddat) in the same style as ye live, according to your means: Annoy them not, so as to restrict them. And if they carry (life in their wombs), then spend (your substance) on them until they deliver their burden: and if they suckle your (offspring), give them their recompense: and take mutual counsel together, according to what is just and reasonable. And if ye find yourselves in difficulties, let another woman suckle (the child) on the (father's) behalf.

occurrences.arabic_text: فَذَاقَتْ وَبَالَ أَمْرِهَا وَكَانَ عَاقِبَةُ أَمْرِهَا خُسْرًا
occurrences.english_translation: Then did they taste the evil result of their conduct, and the End of their conduct was Perdition.

occurrences.arabic_text: إِنَّمَا تُجْزَوْنَ مَا كُنْتُمْ تَعْمَلُونَ
occurrences.english_translation: (They will say), "O ye Unbelievers! Make no excuses this Day! Ye are being but requited for all that ye did!"

occurrences.arabic_text: كَانَتَا تَحْتَ عَبْدَيْنِ مِنْ عِبَادِنَا صَالِحَيْنِ فَخَانَتَاهُمَا
occurrences.english_translation: Allah sets forth, for an example to the Unbelievers, the wife of Noah and the wife of Lut: they were (respectively) under two of our righteous servants, but they were false to their (husbands), and they profited nothing before Allah on their account, but were told: "Enter ye the Fire along with (others) that enter!"

occurrences.arabic_text: وَصَدَّقَتْ بِكَلِمَاتِ رَبِّهَا وَكُتُبِهِ وَكَانَتْ مِنَ الْقَانِتِينَ
occurrences.english_translation: And Mary the daughter of 'Imran, who guarded her chastity; and We breathed into (her body) of Our spirit; and she testified to the truth of the words of her Lord and of His Revelations, and was one of the devout (servants).

occurrences.arabic_text: وَقَالُوا لَوْ كُنَّا نَسْمَعُ أَوْ نَعْقِلُ
occurrences.english_translation: They will further say: "Had we but listened or used our intelligence, we should not (now) be among the Companions of the Blazing Fire!"

occurrences.arabic_text: مَا كُنَّا فِي أَصْحَابِ السَّعِيرِ
occurrences.english_translation: They will further say: "Had we but listened or used our intelligence, we should not (now) be among the Companions of the Blazing Fire!"

occurrences.arabic_text: وَلَقَدْ كَذَّبَ الَّذِينَ مِنْ قَبْلِهِمْ فَكَيْفَ كَانَ نَكِيرِ
occurrences.english_translation: But indeed men before them rejected (My warning): then how (terrible) was My rejection (of them)?

occurrences.arabic_text: وَيَقُولُونَ مَتَىٰ هَٰذَا الْوَعْدُ إِنْ كُنْتُمْ صَادِقِينَ
occurrences.english_translation: They ask: When will this promise be (fulfilled)? - If ye are telling the truth.

occurrences.arabic_text: وَقِيلَ هَٰذَا الَّذِي كُنْتُمْ بِهِ تَدَّعُونَ
occurrences.english_translation: At length, when they see it close at hand, grieved will be the faces of the Unbelievers, and it will be said (to them): "This is (the promise fulfilled), which ye were calling for!"

occurrences.arabic_text: أَنْ كَانَ ذَا مَالٍ وَبَنِينَ
occurrences.english_translation: Because he possesses wealth and (numerous) sons.

occurrences.arabic_text: أَنِ اغْدُوا عَلَىٰ حَرْثِكُمْ إِنْ كُنْتُمْ صَارِمِينَ
occurrences.english_translation: "Go ye to your tilth (betimes) in the morning, if ye would gather the fruits."

occurrences.arabic_text: قَالُوا سُبْحَانَ رَبِّنَا إِنَّا كُنَّا ظَالِمِينَ
occurrences.english_translation: They said: "Glory to our Lord! Verily we have been doing wrong!"

occurrences.arabic_text: قَالُوا يَا وَيْلَنَا إِنَّا كُنَّا طَاغِينَ
occurrences.english_translation: They said: "Alas for us! We have indeed transgressed!

occurrences.arabic_text: وَلَعَذَابُ الْآخِرَةِ أَكْبَرُ لَوْ كَانُوا يَعْلَمُونَ
occurrences.english_translation: Such is the Punishment (in this life); but greater is the Punishment in the Hereafter,- if only they knew!

occurrences.arabic_text: أَمْ لَهُمْ شُرَكَاءُ فَلْيَأْتُوا بِشُرَكَائِهِمْ إِنْ كَانُوا صَادِقِينَ
occurrences.english_translation: Or have they some "Partners" (in Allahhead)? Then let them produce their "partners", if they are truthful!

occurrences.arabic_text: وَقَدْ كَانُوا يُدْعَوْنَ إِلَى السُّجُودِ وَهُمْ سَالِمُونَ
occurrences.english_translation: Their eyes will be cast down,- ignominy will cover them; seeing that they had been summoned aforetime to bow in adoration, while they were whole, (and had refused).

occurrences.arabic_text: وَلَا تَكُنْ كَصَاحِبِ الْحُوتِ إِذْ نَادَىٰ وَهُوَ مَكْظُومٌ
occurrences.english_translation: So wait with patience for the Command of thy Lord, and be not like the Companion of the Fish,- when he cried out in agony.

occurrences.arabic_text: يَا لَيْتَهَا كَانَتِ الْقَاضِيَةَ
occurrences.english_translation: "Ah! Would that (Death) had made an end of me!

occurrences.arabic_text: إِنَّهُ كَانَ لَا يُؤْمِنُ بِاللَّهِ الْعَظِيمِ
occurrences.english_translation: "This was he that would not believe in Allah Most High.

occurrences.arabic_text: فِي يَوْمٍ كَانَ مِقْدَارُهُ خَمْسِينَ أَلْفَ سَنَةٍ
occurrences.english_translation: The angels and the spirit ascend unto him in a Day the measure whereof is (as) fifty thousand years:

occurrences.arabic_text: يَوْمَ تَكُونُ السَّمَاءُ كَالْمُهْلِ
occurrences.english_translation: The Day that the sky will be like molten brass,

occurrences.arabic_text: وَتَكُونُ الْجِبَالُ كَالْعِهْنِ
occurrences.english_translation: And the mountains will be like wool,

occurrences.arabic_text: ذَٰلِكَ الْيَوْمُ الَّذِي كَانُوا يُوعَدُونَ
occurrences.english_translation: Their eyes lowered in dejection,- ignominy covering them (all over)! such is the Day the which they are promised!

occurrences.arabic_text: إِنَّ أَجَلَ اللَّهِ إِذَا جَاءَ لَا يُؤَخَّرُ لَوْ كُنْتُمْ تَعْلَمُونَ
occurrences.english_translation: "So He may forgive you your sins and give you respite for a stated Term: for when the Term given by Allah is accomplished, it cannot be put forward: if ye only knew."

occurrences.arabic_text: فَقُلْتُ اسْتَغْفِرُوا رَبَّكُمْ إِنَّهُ كَانَ غَفَّارًا
occurrences.english_translation: "Saying, 'Ask forgiveness from your Lord; for He is Oft-Forgiving;

occurrences.arabic_text: وَأَنَّهُ كَانَ يَقُولُ سَفِيهُنَا عَلَى اللَّهِ شَطَطًا
occurrences.english_translation: 'There were some foolish ones among us, who used to utter extravagant lies against Allah;

occurrences.arabic_text: وَأَنَّهُ كَانَ رِجَالٌ مِنَ الْإِنْسِ يَعُوذُونَ بِرِجَالٍ مِنَ الْجِنِّ
occurrences.english_translation: 'True, there were persons among mankind who took shelter with persons among the Jinns, but they increased them in folly.

occurrences.arabic_text: وَأَنَّا كُنَّا نَقْعُدُ مِنْهَا مَقَاعِدَ لِلسَّمْعِ
occurrences.english_translation: 'We used, indeed, to sit there in (hidden) stations, to (steal) a hearing; but any who listen now will find a flaming fire watching him in ambush.

occurrences.arabic_text: وَأَنَّا مِنَّا الصَّالِحُونَ وَمِنَّا دُونَ ذَٰلِكَ كُنَّا طَرَائِقَ قِدَدًا
occurrences.english_translation: 'There are among us some that are righteous, and some the contrary: we follow divergent paths.

occurrences.arabic_text: وَأَمَّا الْقَاسِطُونَ فَكَانُوا لِجَهَنَّمَ حَطَبًا
occurrences.english_translation: 'But those who swerve,- they are (but) fuel for Hell-fire'-

occurrences.arabic_text: وَأَنَّهُ لَمَّا قَامَ عَبْدُ اللَّهِ يَدْعُوهُ كَادُوا يَكُونُونَ عَلَيْهِ لِبَدًا
occurrences.english_translation: "Yet when the Devotee of Allah stands forth to invoke Him, they just make round him a dense crowd."

occurrences.arabic_text: يَوْمَ تَرْجُفُ الْأَرْضُ وَالْجِبَالُ وَكَانَتِ الْجِبَالُ كَثِيبًا مَهِيلًا
occurrences.english_translation: One Day the earth and the mountains will be in violent commotion. And the mountains will be as a heap of sand poured out and flowing down.

occurrences.arabic_text: السَّمَاءُ مُنْفَطِرٌ بِهِ كَانَ وَعْدُهُ مَفْعُولًا
occurrences.english_translation: Whereon the sky will be cleft asunder? His Promise needs must be accomplished.

occurrences.arabic_text: عَلِمَ أَنْ سَيَكُونُ مِنْكُمْ مَرْضَىٰ وَآخَرُونَ يَضْرِبُونَ فِي الْأَرْضِ
occurrences.english_translation: Thy Lord doth know that thou standest forth (to prayer) nigh two-thirds of the night, or half the night, or a third of the night, and so doth a party of those with thee. But Allah doth appoint night and day in due measure He knoweth that ye are unable to keep count thereof. So He hath turned to you (in mercy): read ye, therefore, of the Qur'an as much as may be easy for you. He knoweth that there may be (some) among you in ill-health; others travelling through the land, seeking of Allah's bounty; yet others fighting in Allah's Cause, read ye, therefore, as much of the Qur'an as may be easy (for you); and establish regular Prayer and give regular Charity; and loan to Allah a Beautiful Loan. And whatever good ye send forth for your souls ye shall find it in Allah's Presence,- yea, better and greater, in Reward and seek ye the Grace of Allah: for Allah is Oft-Forgiving, Most Merciful.

occurrences.arabic_text: كَلَّا إِنَّهُ كَانَ لِآيَاتِنَا عَنِيدًا
occurrences.english_translation: By no means! For to Our Signs he has been refractory!

occurrences.arabic_text: قَالُوا لَمْ نَكُ مِنَ الْمُصَلِّينَ
occurrences.english_translation: They will say: "We were not of those who prayed;

occurrences.arabic_text: وَلَمْ نَكُ نُطْعِمُ الْمِسْكِينَ
occurrences.english_translation: "Nor were we of those who fed the indigent;

occurrences.arabic_text: وَكُنَّا نَخُوضُ مَعَ الْخَائِضِينَ
occurrences.english_translation: "But we used to talk vanities with vain talkers;

occurrences.arabic_text: وَكُنَّا نُكَذِّبُ بِيَوْمِ الدِّينِ
occurrences.english_translation: "And we used to deny the Day of Judgment,

occurrences.arabic_text: أَلَمْ يَكُ نُطْفَةً مِنْ مَنِيٍّ يُمْنَىٰ
occurrences.english_translation: Was he not a drop of sperm emitted (in lowly form)?

occurrences.arabic_text: ثُمَّ كَانَ عَلَقَةً فَخَلَقَ فَسَوَّىٰ
occurrences.english_translation: Then did he become a leech-like clot; then did (Allah) make and fashion (him) in due proportion.

occurrences.arabic_text: هَلْ أَتَىٰ عَلَى الْإِنْسَانِ حِينٌ مِنَ الدَّهْرِ لَمْ يَكُنْ شَيْئًا مَذْكُورًا
occurrences.english_translation: Has there not been over Man a long period of Time, when he was nothing - (not even) mentioned?

occurrences.arabic_text: إِنَّ الْأَبْرَارَ يَشْرَبُونَ مِنْ كَأْسٍ كَانَ مِزَاجُهَا كَافُورًا
occurrences.english_translation: As to the Righteous, they shall drink of a Cup (of Wine) mixed with Kafur,-

occurrences.arabic_text: يُوفُونَ بِالنَّذْرِ وَيَخَافُونَ يَوْمًا كَانَ شَرُّهُ مُسْتَطِيرًا
occurrences.english_translation: They perform (their) vows, and they fear a Day whose evil flies far and wide.

occurrences.arabic_text: وَيُطَافُ عَلَيْهِمْ بِآنِيَةٍ مِنْ فِضَّةٍ وَأَكْوَابٍ كَانَتْ قَوَارِيرَا
occurrences.english_translation: And amongst them will be passed round vessels of silver and goblets of crystal,-

occurrences.arabic_text: وَيُسْقَوْنَ فِيهَا كَأْسًا كَانَ مِزَاجُهَا زَنْجَبِيلًا
occurrences.english_translation: And they will be given to drink there of a Cup (of Wine) mixed with Zanjabil,-

occurrences.arabic_text: إِنَّ هَٰذَا كَانَ لَكُمْ جَزَاءً
occurrences.english_translation: "Verily this is a Reward for you, and your Endeavour is accepted and recognised."

occurrences.arabic_text: وَكَانَ سَعْيُكُمْ مَشْكُورًا
occurrences.english_translation: "Verily this is a Reward for you, and your Endeavour is accepted and recognised."

occurrences.arabic_text: وَمَا تَشَاءُونَ إِلَّا أَنْ يَشَاءَ اللَّهُ إِنَّ اللَّهَ كَانَ عَلِيمًا حَكِيمًا
occurrences.english_translation: But ye will not, except as Allah wills; for Allah is full of Knowledge and Wisdom.

occurrences.arabic_text: انْطَلِقُوا إِلَىٰ مَا كُنْتُمْ بِهِ تُكَذِّبُونَ
occurrences.english_translation: (It will be said:) "Depart ye to that which ye used to reject as false!

occurrences.arabic_text: فَإِنْ كَانَ لَكُمْ كَيْدٌ فَكِيدُونِ
occurrences.english_translation: Now, if ye have a trick (or plot), use it against Me!

occurrences.arabic_text: كُلُوا وَاشْرَبُوا هَنِيئًا بِمَا كُنْتُمْ تَعْمَلُونَ
occurrences.english_translation: "Eat ye and drink ye to your heart's content: for that ye worked (Righteousness).

occurrences.arabic_text: إِنَّ يَوْمَ الْفَصْلِ كَانَ مِيقَاتًا
occurrences.english_translation: Verily the Day of Sorting out is a thing appointed,

occurrences.arabic_text: وَفُتِحَتِ السَّمَاءُ فَكَانَتْ أَبْوَابًا
occurrences.english_translation: And the heavens shall be opened as if there were doors,

occurrences.arabic_text: وَسُيِّرَتِ الْجِبَالُ فَكَانَتْ سَرَابًا
occurrences.english_translation: And the mountains shall vanish, as if they were a mirage.

occurrences.arabic_text: إِنَّ جَهَنَّمَ كَانَتْ مِرْصَادًا
occurrences.english_translation: Truly Hell is as a place of ambush,

occurrences.arabic_text: إِنَّهُمْ كَانُوا لَا يَرْجُونَ حِسَابًا
occurrences.english_translation: For that they used not to fear any account (for their deeds),

occurrences.arabic_text: وَيَقُولُ الْكَافِرُ يَا لَيْتَنِي كُنْتُ تُرَابًا
occurrences.english_translation: Verily, We have warned you of a Penalty near, the Day when man will see (the deeds) which his hands have sent forth, and the Unbeliever will say, "Woe unto me! Would that I were (metre) dust!"

occurrences.arabic_text: أَإِذَا كُنَّا عِظَامًا نَخِرَةً
occurrences.english_translation: "What! - when we shall have become rotten bones?"

occurrences.arabic_text: كَلَّا بَلْ رَانَ عَلَىٰ قُلُوبِهِمْ مَا كَانُوا يَكْسِبُونَ
occurrences.english_translation: By no means! but on their hearts is the stain of the (ill) which they do!

occurrences.arabic_text: ثُمَّ يُقَالُ هَٰذَا الَّذِي كُنْتُمْ بِهِ تُكَذِّبُونَ
occurrences.english_translation: Further, it will be said to them: "This is the (reality) which ye rejected as false!

occurrences.arabic_text: إِنَّ الَّذِينَ أَجْرَمُوا كَانُوا مِنَ الَّذِينَ آمَنُوا يَضْحَكُونَ
occurrences.english_translation: Those in sin used to laugh at those who believed,

occurrences.arabic_text: هَلْ ثُوِّبَ الْكُفَّارُ مَا كَانُوا يَفْعَلُونَ
occurrences.english_translation: Will not the Unbelievers have been paid back for what they did?

occurrences.arabic_text: إِنَّهُ كَانَ فِي أَهْلِهِ مَسْرُورًا
occurrences.english_translation: Truly, did he go about among his people, rejoicing!

occurrences.arabic_text: بَلَىٰ إِنَّ رَبَّهُ كَانَ بِهِ بَصِيرًا
occurrences.english_translation: Nay, nay! for his Lord was (ever) watchful of him!

occurrences.arabic_text: ثُمَّ كَانَ مِنَ الَّذِينَ آمَنُوا وَتَوَاصَوْا بِالصَّبْرِ وَتَوَاصَوْا بِالْمَرْحَمَةِ
occurrences.english_translation: Then will he be of those who believe, and enjoin patience, (constancy, and self-restraint), and enjoin deeds of kindness and compassion.

occurrences.arabic_text: أَرَأَيْتَ إِنْ كَانَ عَلَى الْهُدَىٰ
occurrences.english_translation: Seest thou if he is on (the road of) Guidance?-

occurrences.arabic_text: لَمْ يَكُنِ الَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا مِنْ أَهْلِ الْكِتَابِ وَالْمُشْرِكِينَ مُنْفَكِّينَ حَتَّىٰ تَأْتِيَهُمُ الْبَيِّنَةُ
occurrences.english_translation: Those who reject (Truth), among the People of the Book and among the Polytheists, were not going to depart (from their ways) until there should come to them Clear Evidence,-

occurrences.arabic_text: يَوْمَ يَكُونُ النَّاسُ كَالْفَرَاشِ الْمَبْثُوثِ
occurrences.english_translation: (It is) a Day whereon men will be like moths scattered about,

occurrences.arabic_text: وَتَكُونُ الْجِبَالُ كَالْعِهْنِ الْمَنْفُوشِ
occurrences.english_translation: And the mountains will be like carded wool.

occurrences.arabic_text: فَسَبِّحْ بِحَمْدِ رَبِّكَ وَاسْتَغْفِرْهُ إِنَّهُ كَانَ تَوَّابًا
occurrences.english_translation: Celebrate the praises of thy Lord, and pray for His Forgiveness: For He is Oft-Returning (in Grace and Mercy).

occurrences.arabic_text: وَلَمْ يَكُنْ لَهُ كُفُوًا أَحَدٌ
occurrences.english_translation: And there is none like unto Him.

occurrences.arabic_text: وَإِنْ أَرَدْتُمُ اسْتِبْدَالَ زَوْجٍ مَكَانَ زَوْجٍ وَآتَيْتُمْ إِحْدَاهُنَّ قِنْطَارًا فَلَا تَأْخُذُوا مِنْهُ شَيْئًا
occurrences.english_translation: But if ye decide to take one wife in place of another, even if ye had given the latter a whole treasure for dower, Take not the least bit of it back: Would ye take it by slander and manifest wrong?

occurrences.arabic_text: أُولَٰئِكَ شَرٌّ مَكَانًا وَأَضَلُّ عَنْ سَوَاءِ السَّبِيلِ
occurrences.english_translation: Say: "Shall I point out to you something much worse than this, (as judged) by the treatment it received from Allah? those who incurred the curse of Allah and His wrath, those of whom some He transformed into apes and swine, those who worshipped evil;- these are (many times) worse in rank, and far more astray from the even path!"

occurrences.arabic_text: ثُمَّ بَدَّلْنَا مَكَانَ السَّيِّئَةِ الْحَسَنَةَ حَتَّىٰ عَفَوْا
occurrences.english_translation: Then We changed their suffering into prosperity, until they grew and multiplied, and began to say: "Our fathers (too) were touched by suffering and affluence"... Behold! We called them to account of a sudden, while they realised not (their peril).

occurrences.arabic_text: وَلَٰكِنِ انْظُرْ إِلَى الْجَبَلِ فَإِنِ اسْتَقَرَّ مَكَانَهُ فَسَوْفَ تَرَانِي
occurrences.english_translation: When Moses came to the place appointed by Us, and his Lord addressed him, He said: "O my Lord! show (Thyself) to me, that I may look upon thee." Allah said: "By no means canst thou see Me (direct); But look upon the mount; if it abide in its place, then shalt thou see Me." When his Lord manifested His glory on the Mount, He made it as dust. And Moses fell down in a swoon. When he recovered his senses he said: "Glory be to Thee! to Thee I turn in repentance, and I am the first to believe."

occurrences.arabic_text: جَاءَتْهَا رِيحٌ عَاصِفٌ وَجَاءَهُمُ الْمَوْجُ مِنْ كُلِّ مَكَانٍ
occurrences.english_translation: He it is Who enableth you to traverse through land and sea; so that ye even board ships;- they sail with them with a favourable wind, and they rejoice thereat; then comes a stormy wind and the waves come to them from all sides, and they think they are being overwhelmed: they cry unto Allah, sincerely offering (their) duty unto Him saying, "If thou dost deliver us from this, we shall truly show our gratitude!"

occurrences.arabic_text: ثُمَّ نَقُولُ لِلَّذِينَ أَشْرَكُوا مَكَانَكُمْ أَنْتُمْ وَشُرَكَاؤُكُمْ
occurrences.english_translation: One day shall We gather them all together. Then shall We say to those who joined gods (with Us): "To your place! ye and those ye joined as 'partners' We shall separate them, and their "Partners" shall say: "It was not us that ye worshipped!

occurrences.arabic_text: قَالَ أَنْتُمْ شَرٌّ مَكَانًا وَاللَّهُ أَعْلَمُ بِمَا تَصِفُونَ
occurrences.english_translation: They said: "If he steals, there was a brother of his who did steal before (him)." But these things did Joseph keep locked in his heart, revealing not the secrets to them. He (simply) said (to himself): "Ye are the worse situated; and Allah knoweth best the truth of what ye assert!"

occurrences.arabic_text: قَالُوا يَا أَيُّهَا الْعَزِيزُ إِنَّ لَهُ أَبًا شَيْخًا كَبِيرًا فَخُذْ أَحَدَنَا مَكَانَهُ
occurrences.english_translation: They said: "O exalted one! Behold! he has a father, aged and venerable, (who will grieve for him); so take one of us in his place; for we see that thou art (gracious) in doing good."

occurrences.arabic_text: وَيَأْتِيهِ الْمَوْتُ مِنْ كُلِّ مَكَانٍ وَمَا هُوَ بِمَيِّتٍ
occurrences.english_translation: In gulps will he sip it, but never will he be near swallowing it down his throat: death will come to him from every quarter, yet will he not die: and in front of him will be a chastisement unrelenting.

occurrences.arabic_text: وَإِذَا بَدَّلْنَا آيَةً مَكَانَ آيَةٍ وَاللَّهُ أَعْلَمُ بِمَا يُنَزِّلُ قَالُوا إِنَّمَا أَنْتَ مُفْتَرٍ
occurrences.english_translation: When We substitute one revelation for another,- and Allah knows best what He reveals (in stages),- they say, "Thou art but a forger": but most of them understand not.

occurrences.arabic_text: كَانَتْ آمِنَةً مُطْمَئِنَّةً يَأْتِيهَا رِزْقُهَا رَغَدًا مِنْ كُلِّ مَكَانٍ
occurrences.english_translation: Allah sets forth a Parable: a city enjoying security and quiet, abundantly supplied with sustenance from every place: Yet was it ungrateful for the favours of Allah: so Allah made it taste of hunger and terror (in extremes) (closing in on it) like a garment (from every side), because of the (evil) which (its people) wrought.

occurrences.arabic_text: وَرَفَعْنَاهُ مَكَانًا عَلِيًّا
occurrences.english_translation: And We raised him to a lofty station.

occurrences.arabic_text: فَسَيَعْلَمُونَ مَنْ هُوَ شَرٌّ مَكَانًا وَأَضْعَفُ جُنْدًا
occurrences.english_translation: Say: "If any men go astray, (Allah) Most Gracious extends (the rope) to them, until, when they see the warning of Allah (being fulfilled) - either in punishment or in (the approach of) the Hour,- they will at length realise who is worst in position, and (who) weakest in forces!

occurrences.arabic_text: لَا نُخْلِفُهُ نَحْنُ وَلَا أَنْتَ مَكَانًا سُوًى
occurrences.english_translation: "But we can surely produce magic to match thine! So make a tryst between us and thee, which we shall not fail to keep - neither we nor thou - in a place where both shall have even chances."

occurrences.arabic_text: وَإِذْ بَوَّأْنَا لِإِبْرَاهِيمَ مَكَانَ الْبَيْتِ أَنْ لَا تُشْرِكْ بِي شَيْئًا
occurrences.english_translation: Behold! We gave the site, to Abraham, of the (Sacred) House, (saying): "Associate not anything (in worship) with Me; and sanctify My House for those who compass it round, or stand up, or bow, or prostrate themselves (therein in prayer).

occurrences.arabic_text: أَوْ تَهْوِي بِهِ الرِّيحُ فِي مَكَانٍ سَحِيقٍ
occurrences.english_translation: Being true in faith to Allah, and never assigning partners to Him: if anyone assigns partners to Allah, is as if he had fallen from heaven and been snatched up by birds, or the wind had swooped (like a bird on its prey) and thrown him into a far-distant place.

occurrences.arabic_text: إِذَا رَأَتْهُمْ مِنْ مَكَانٍ بَعِيدٍ سَمِعُوا لَهَا تَغَيُّظًا وَزَفِيرًا
occurrences.english_translation: When it sees them from a place far off, they will hear its fury and its ranging sigh.

occurrences.arabic_text: وَإِذَا أُلْقُوا مِنْهَا مَكَانًا ضَيِّقًا مُقَرَّنِينَ دَعَوْا هُنَالِكَ ثُبُورًا
occurrences.english_translation: And when they are cast, bound together into a constricted place therein, they will plead for destruction there and then!

occurrences.arabic_text: أُولَٰئِكَ شَرٌّ مَكَانًا وَأَضَلُّ سَبِيلًا
occurrences.english_translation: Those who will be gathered to Hell (prone) on their faces,- they will be in an evil plight, and, as to Path, most astray.

occurrences.arabic_text: وَأَصْبَحَ الَّذِينَ تَمَنَّوْا مَكَانَهُ بِالْأَمْسِ يَقُولُونَ
occurrences.english_translation: And those who had envied his position the day before began to say on the morrow: "Ah! it is indeed Allah Who enlarges the provision or restricts it, to any of His servants He pleases! had it not been that Allah was gracious to us, He could have caused the earth to swallow us up! Ah! those who reject Allah will assuredly never prosper."

occurrences.arabic_text: وَلَوْ تَرَىٰ إِذْ فَزِعُوا فَلَا فَوْتَ وَأُخِذُوا مِنْ مَكَانٍ قَرِيبٍ
occurrences.english_translation: If thou couldst but see when they will quake with terror; but then there will be no escape (for them), and they will be seized from a position (quite) near.

occurrences.arabic_text: وَقَالُوا آمَنَّا بِهِ وَأَنَّىٰ لَهُمُ التَّنَاوُشُ مِنْ مَكَانٍ بَعِيدٍ
occurrences.english_translation: And they will say, "We do believe (now) in the (Truth)"; but how could they receive (Faith) from a position (so far off,-

occurrences.arabic_text: وَقَدْ كَفَرُوا بِهِ مِنْ قَبْلُ وَيَقْذِفُونَ بِالْغَيْبِ مِنْ مَكَانٍ بَعِيدٍ
occurrences.english_translation: Seeing that they did reject Faith (entirely) before, and that they (continually) cast (slanders) on the unseen from a position far off?

occurrences.arabic_text: أُولَٰئِكَ يُنَادَوْنَ مِنْ مَكَانٍ بَعِيدٍ
occurrences.english_translation: Had We sent this as a Qur'an (in the language) other than Arabic, they would have said: "Why are not its verses explained in detail? What! (a Book) not in Arabic and (a Messenger an Arab?" Say: "It is a Guide and a Healing to those who believe; and for those who believe not, there is a deafness in their ears, and it is blindness in their (eyes): They are (as it were) being called from a place far distant!"

occurrences.arabic_text: وَاسْتَمِعْ يَوْمَ يُنَادِ الْمُنَادِ مِنْ مَكَانٍ قَرِيبٍ
occurrences.english_translation: And listen for the Day when the Caller will call out from a place quiet near,-

occurrences.arabic_text: وَاذْكُرْ فِي الْكِتَابِ مَرْيَمَ إِذِ انْتَبَذَتْ مِنْ أَهْلِهَا مَكَانًا شَرْقِيًّا
occurrences.english_translation: Relate in the Book (the story of) Mary, when she withdrew from her family to a place in the East.

occurrences.arabic_text: فَحَمَلَتْهُ فَانْتَبَذَتْ بِهِ مَكَانًا قَصِيًّا
occurrences.english_translation: So she conceived him, and she retired with him to a remote place.

occurrences.arabic_text: قُلْ يَا قَوْمِ اعْمَلُوا عَلَىٰ مَكَانَتِكُمْ إِنِّي عَامِلٌ
occurrences.english_translation: Say: "O my people! Do whatever ye can: I will do (my part): soon will ye know who it is whose end will be (best) in the Hereafter: certain it is that the wrong-doers will not prosper."

occurrences.arabic_text: وَيَا قَوْمِ اعْمَلُوا عَلَىٰ مَكَانَتِكُمْ إِنِّي عَامِلٌ
occurrences.english_translation: "And O my people! Do whatever ye can: I will do (my part): Soon will ye know who it is on whom descends the penalty of ignominy; and who is a liar! and watch ye! for I too am watching with you!"

occurrences.arabic_text: وَقُلْ لِلَّذِينَ لَا يُؤْمِنُونَ اعْمَلُوا عَلَىٰ مَكَانَتِكُمْ إِنَّا عَامِلُونَ
occurrences.english_translation: Say to those who do not believe: "Do what ever ye can: We shall do our part;

occurrences.arabic_text: وَلَوْ نَشَاءُ لَمَسَخْنَاهُمْ عَلَىٰ مَكَانَتِهِمْ
occurrences.english_translation: And if it had been Our Will, We could have transformed them (to remain) in their places; then should they have been unable to move about, nor could they have returned (after error).

occurrences.arabic_text: قُلْ يَا قَوْمِ اعْمَلُوا عَلَىٰ مَكَانَتِكُمْ إِنِّي عَامِلٌ فَسَوْفَ تَعْلَمُونَ
occurrences.english_translation: Say: "O my People! Do whatever ye can: I will do (my part): but soon will ye know-

description: The triliteral root kāf wāw yā (ك و ي) occurs only once in the Quran, as the form I verb tuk'wā (تُكْوَىٰ). The translation below is a brief gloss intended as a guide to meaning. An Arabic word may have a range of meanings depending on context. Click on the word for more linguistic information, or to suggestion a correction.

occurrences.arabic_text: يَوْمَ يُحْمَىٰ عَلَيْهَا فِي نَارِ جَهَنَّمَ فَتُكْوَىٰ بِهَا جِبَاهُهُمْ
occurrences.english_translation: On the Day when heat will be produced out of that (wealth) in the fire of Hell, and with it will be branded their foreheads, their flanks, and their backs, their flanks, and their backs.- "This is the (treasure) which ye buried for yourselves: taste ye, then, the (treasures) ye buried!"

description: The triliteral root kāf yā dāl (ك ي د) occurs 35 times in the Quran, in three derived forms:
meaning: to scheme, to plot, to plan

occurrences.arabic_text: قُلِ ادْعُوا شُرَكَاءَكُمْ ثُمَّ كِيدُونِ فَلَا تُنْظِرُونِ
occurrences.english_translation: Have they feet to walk with? Or hands to lay hold with? Or eyes to see with? Or ears to hear with? Say: "Call your 'god-partners', scheme (your worst) against me, and give me no respite!

occurrences.arabic_text: مِنْ دُونِهِ فَكِيدُونِي جَمِيعًا ثُمَّ لَا تُنْظِرُونِ
occurrences.english_translation: "Other gods as partners! so scheme (your worst) against me, all of you, and give me no respite.

occurrences.arabic_text: لَا تَقْصُصْ رُؤْيَاكَ عَلَىٰ إِخْوَتِكَ فَيَكِيدُوا لَكَ كَيْدًا
occurrences.english_translation: Said (the father): "My (dear) little son! relate not thy vision to thy brothers, lest they concoct a plot against thee: for Satan is to man an avowed enemy!

occurrences.arabic_text: كَذَٰلِكَ كِدْنَا لِيُوسُفَ
occurrences.english_translation: So he began (the search) with their baggage, before (he came to) the baggage of his brother: at length he brought it out of his brother's baggage. Thus did We plan for Joseph. He could not take his brother by the law of the king except that Allah willed it (so). We raise to degrees (of wisdom) whom We please: but over all endued with knowledge is one, the All-Knowing.

occurrences.arabic_text: وَتَاللَّهِ لَأَكِيدَنَّ أَصْنَامَكُمْ بَعْدَ أَنْ تُوَلُّوا مُدْبِرِينَ
occurrences.english_translation: "And by Allah, I have a plan for your idols - after ye go away and turn your backs"..

occurrences.arabic_text: فَإِنْ كَانَ لَكُمْ كَيْدٌ فَكِيدُونِ
occurrences.english_translation: Now, if ye have a trick (or plot), use it against Me!

occurrences.arabic_text: إِنَّهُمْ يَكِيدُونَ كَيْدًا
occurrences.english_translation: As for them, they are but plotting a scheme,

occurrences.arabic_text: وَأَكِيدُ كَيْدًا
occurrences.english_translation: And I am planning a scheme.

occurrences.arabic_text: وَإِنْ تَصْبِرُوا وَتَتَّقُوا لَا يَضُرُّكُمْ كَيْدُهُمْ شَيْئًا
occurrences.english_translation: If aught that is good befalls you, it grieves them; but if some misfortune overtakes you, they rejoice at it. But if ye are constant and do right, not the least harm will their cunning do to you; for Allah Compasseth round about all that they do.

occurrences.arabic_text: فَقَاتِلُوا أَوْلِيَاءَ الشَّيْطَانِ إِنَّ كَيْدَ الشَّيْطَانِ كَانَ ضَعِيفًا
occurrences.english_translation: Those who believe fight in the cause of Allah, and those who reject Faith Fight in the cause of Evil: So fight ye against the friends of Satan: feeble indeed is the cunning of Satan.

occurrences.arabic_text: وَأُمْلِي لَهُمْ إِنَّ كَيْدِي مَتِينٌ
occurrences.english_translation: Respite will I grant unto them: for My scheme is strong (and unfailing).

occurrences.arabic_text: ذَٰلِكُمْ وَأَنَّ اللَّهَ مُوهِنُ كَيْدِ الْكَافِرِينَ
occurrences.english_translation: That, and also because Allah is He Who makes feeble the plans and stratagem of the Unbelievers.

occurrences.arabic_text: لَا تَقْصُصْ رُؤْيَاكَ عَلَىٰ إِخْوَتِكَ فَيَكِيدُوا لَكَ كَيْدًا
occurrences.english_translation: Said (the father): "My (dear) little son! relate not thy vision to thy brothers, lest they concoct a plot against thee: for Satan is to man an avowed enemy!

occurrences.arabic_text: فَلَمَّا رَأَىٰ قَمِيصَهُ قُدَّ مِنْ دُبُرٍ قَالَ إِنَّهُ مِنْ كَيْدِكُنَّ
occurrences.english_translation: So when he saw his shirt,- that it was torn at the back,- (her husband) said: "Behold! It is a snare of you women! truly, mighty is your snare!

occurrences.arabic_text: إِنَّ كَيْدَكُنَّ عَظِيمٌ
occurrences.english_translation: So when he saw his shirt,- that it was torn at the back,- (her husband) said: "Behold! It is a snare of you women! truly, mighty is your snare!

occurrences.arabic_text: وَإِلَّا تَصْرِفْ عَنِّي كَيْدَهُنَّ أَصْبُ إِلَيْهِنَّ
occurrences.english_translation: He said: "O my Lord! the prison is more to my liking than that to which they invite me: Unless Thou turn away their snare from me, I should (in my youthful folly) feel inclined towards them and join the ranks of the ignorant."

occurrences.arabic_text: فَاسْتَجَابَ لَهُ رَبُّهُ فَصَرَفَ عَنْهُ كَيْدَهُنَّ
occurrences.english_translation: So his Lord hearkened to him (in his prayer), and turned away from him their snare: Verily He heareth and knoweth (all things).

occurrences.arabic_text: مَا بَالُ النِّسْوَةِ اللَّاتِي قَطَّعْنَ أَيْدِيَهُنَّ إِنَّ رَبِّي بِكَيْدِهِنَّ عَلِيمٌ
occurrences.english_translation: So the king said: "Bring ye him unto me." But when the messenger came to him, (Joseph) said: "Go thou back to thy lord, and ask him, 'What is the state of mind of the ladies who cut their hands'? For my Lord is certainly well aware of their snare."

occurrences.arabic_text: ذَٰلِكَ لِيَعْلَمَ أَنِّي لَمْ أَخُنْهُ بِالْغَيْبِ وَأَنَّ اللَّهَ لَا يَهْدِي كَيْدَ الْخَائِنِينَ
occurrences.english_translation: "This (say I), in order that He may know that I have never been false to him in his absence, and that Allah will never guide the snare of the false ones.

occurrences.arabic_text: فَتَوَلَّىٰ فِرْعَوْنُ فَجَمَعَ كَيْدَهُ ثُمَّ أَتَىٰ
occurrences.english_translation: So Pharaoh withdrew: He concerted his plan, and then came (back).

occurrences.arabic_text: فَأَجْمِعُوا كَيْدَكُمْ ثُمَّ ائْتُوا صَفًّا
occurrences.english_translation: "Therefore concert your plan, and then assemble in (serried) ranks: He wins (all along) today who gains the upper hand."

occurrences.arabic_text: إِنَّمَا صَنَعُوا كَيْدُ سَاحِرٍ وَلَا يُفْلِحُ السَّاحِرُ حَيْثُ أَتَىٰ
occurrences.english_translation: "Throw that which is in thy right hand: Quickly will it swallow up that which they have faked what they have faked is but a magician's trick: and the magician thrives not, (no matter) where he goes."

occurrences.arabic_text: وَأَرَادُوا بِهِ كَيْدًا فَجَعَلْنَاهُمُ الْأَخْسَرِينَ
occurrences.english_translation: Then they sought a stratagem against him: but We made them the ones that lost most!

occurrences.arabic_text: ثُمَّ لْيَقْطَعْ فَلْيَنْظُرْ هَلْ يُذْهِبَنَّ كَيْدُهُ مَا يَغِيظُ
occurrences.english_translation: If any think that Allah will not help him (His Messenger) in this world and the Hereafter, let him stretch out a rope to the ceiling and cut (himself) off: then let him see whether his plan will remove that which enrages (him)!

occurrences.arabic_text: فَأَرَادُوا بِهِ كَيْدًا فَجَعَلْنَاهُمُ الْأَسْفَلِينَ
occurrences.english_translation: (This failing), they then sought a stratagem against him, but We made them the ones most humiliated!

occurrences.arabic_text: وَمَا كَيْدُ الْكَافِرِينَ إِلَّا فِي ضَلَالٍ
occurrences.english_translation: Now, when he came to them in Truth, from Us, they said, "Slay the sons of those who believe with him, and keep alive their females," but the plots of Unbelievers (end) in nothing but errors (and delusions)!...

occurrences.arabic_text: وَمَا كَيْدُ فِرْعَوْنَ إِلَّا فِي تَبَابٍ
occurrences.english_translation: "The ways and means of (reaching) the heavens, and that I may mount up to the god of Moses: But as far as I am concerned, I think (Moses) is a liar!" Thus was made alluring, in Pharaoh's eyes, the evil of his deeds, and he was hindered from the Path; and the plot of Pharaoh led to nothing but perdition (for him).

occurrences.arabic_text: أَمْ يُرِيدُونَ كَيْدًا فَالَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا هُمُ الْمَكِيدُونَ
occurrences.english_translation: Or do they intend a plot (against thee)? But those who defy Allah are themselves involved in a Plot!

occurrences.arabic_text: يَوْمَ لَا يُغْنِي عَنْهُمْ كَيْدُهُمْ شَيْئًا وَلَا هُمْ يُنْصَرُونَ
occurrences.english_translation: The Day when their plotting will avail them nothing and no help shall be given them.

occurrences.arabic_text: وَأُمْلِي لَهُمْ إِنَّ كَيْدِي مَتِينٌ
occurrences.english_translation: A (long) respite will I grant them: truly powerful is My Plan.

occurrences.arabic_text: فَإِنْ كَانَ لَكُمْ كَيْدٌ فَكِيدُونِ
occurrences.english_translation: Now, if ye have a trick (or plot), use it against Me!

occurrences.arabic_text: إِنَّهُمْ يَكِيدُونَ كَيْدًا
occurrences.english_translation: As for them, they are but plotting a scheme,

occurrences.arabic_text: وَأَكِيدُ كَيْدًا
occurrences.english_translation: And I am planning a scheme.

occurrences.arabic_text: أَلَمْ يَجْعَلْ كَيْدَهُمْ فِي تَضْلِيلٍ
occurrences.english_translation: Did He not make their treacherous plan go astray?

occurrences.arabic_text: أَمْ يُرِيدُونَ كَيْدًا فَالَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا هُمُ الْمَكِيدُونَ
occurrences.english_translation: Or do they intend a plot (against thee)? But those who defy Allah are themselves involved in a Plot!

description: The triliteral root kāf yā fā (ك ي ف) occurs 83 times in the Quran as the nominal kayf (كَيْف). The translations below are brief glosses intended as a guide to meaning. An Arabic word may have a range of meanings depending on context. Click on a word for more linguistic information, or to suggestion a correction.

occurrences.arabic_text: كَيْفَ تَكْفُرُونَ بِاللَّهِ وَكُنْتُمْ أَمْوَاتًا فَأَحْيَاكُمْ
occurrences.english_translation: How can ye reject the faith in Allah?- seeing that ye were without life, and He gave you life; then will He cause you to die, and will again bring you to life; and again to Him will ye return.

occurrences.arabic_text: وَانْظُرْ إِلَى الْعِظَامِ كَيْفَ نُنْشِزُهَا ثُمَّ نَكْسُوهَا لَحْمًا
occurrences.english_translation: Or (take) the similitude of one who passed by a hamlet, all in ruins to its roofs. He said: "Oh! how shall Allah bring it (ever) to life, after (this) its death?" but Allah caused him to die for a hundred years, then raised him up (again). He said: "How long didst thou tarry (thus)?" He said: (Perhaps) a day or part of a day." He said: "Nay, thou hast tarried thus a hundred years; but look at thy food and thy drink; they show no signs of age; and look at thy donkey: And that We may make of thee a sign unto the people, Look further at the bones, how We bring them together and clothe them with flesh." When this was shown clearly to him, he said: "I know that Allah hath power over all things."

occurrences.arabic_text: وَإِذْ قَالَ إِبْرَاهِيمُ رَبِّ أَرِنِي كَيْفَ تُحْيِي الْمَوْتَىٰ
occurrences.english_translation: When Abraham said: "Show me, Lord, how You will raise the dead, " He replied: "Have you no faith?" He said "Yes, but just to reassure my heart." Allah said, "Take four birds, draw them to you, and cut their bodies to pieces. Scatter them over the mountain-tops, then call them back. They will come swiftly to you. Know that Allah is Mighty, Wise."

occurrences.arabic_text: هُوَ الَّذِي يُصَوِّرُكُمْ فِي الْأَرْحَامِ كَيْفَ يَشَاءُ
occurrences.english_translation: He it is Who shapes you in the wombs as He pleases. There is no god but He, the Exalted in Might, the Wise.

occurrences.arabic_text: فَكَيْفَ إِذَا جَمَعْنَاهُمْ لِيَوْمٍ لَا رَيْبَ فِيهِ
occurrences.english_translation: But how (will they fare) when we gather them together against a day about which there is no doubt, and each soul will be paid out just what it has earned, without (favour or) injustice?

occurrences.arabic_text: كَيْفَ يَهْدِي اللَّهُ قَوْمًا كَفَرُوا بَعْدَ إِيمَانِهِمْ
occurrences.english_translation: How shall Allah Guide those who reject Faith after they accepted it and bore witness that the Messenger was true and that Clear Signs had come unto them? but Allah guides not a people unjust.

occurrences.arabic_text: وَكَيْفَ تَكْفُرُونَ وَأَنْتُمْ تُتْلَىٰ عَلَيْكُمْ آيَاتُ اللَّهِ وَفِيكُمْ رَسُولُهُ
occurrences.english_translation: And how would ye deny Faith while unto you are rehearsed the Signs of Allah, and among you Lives the Messenger? Whoever holds firmly to Allah will be shown a way that is straight.

occurrences.arabic_text: فَسِيرُوا فِي الْأَرْضِ فَانْظُرُوا كَيْفَ كَانَ عَاقِبَةُ الْمُكَذِّبِينَ
occurrences.english_translation: Many were the Ways of Life that have passed away before you: travel through the earth, and see what was the end of those who rejected Truth.

occurrences.arabic_text: وَكَيْفَ تَأْخُذُونَهُ وَقَدْ أَفْضَىٰ بَعْضُكُمْ إِلَىٰ بَعْضٍ
occurrences.english_translation: And how could ye take it when ye have gone in unto each other, and they have Taken from you a solemn covenant?

occurrences.arabic_text: فَكَيْفَ إِذَا جِئْنَا مِنْ كُلِّ أُمَّةٍ بِشَهِيدٍ
occurrences.english_translation: How then if We brought from each people a witness, and We brought thee as a witness against these people!

occurrences.arabic_text: انْظُرْ كَيْفَ يَفْتَرُونَ عَلَى اللَّهِ الْكَذِبَ وَكَفَىٰ بِهِ إِثْمًا مُبِينًا
occurrences.english_translation: Behold! how they invent a lie against Allah! but that by itself is a manifest sin!

occurrences.arabic_text: فَكَيْفَ إِذَا أَصَابَتْهُمْ مُصِيبَةٌ بِمَا قَدَّمَتْ أَيْدِيهِمْ
occurrences.english_translation: How then, when they are seized by misfortune, because of the deeds which they hands have sent forth? Then their come to thee, swearing by Allah: "We meant no more than good-will and conciliation!"

occurrences.arabic_text: وَكَيْفَ يُحَكِّمُونَكَ وَعِنْدَهُمُ التَّوْرَاةُ فِيهَا حُكْمُ اللَّهِ
occurrences.english_translation: But why do they come to thee for decision, when they have (their own) law before them?- therein is the (plain) command of Allah; yet even after that, they would turn away. For they are not (really) People of Faith.

occurrences.arabic_text: قُلْ سِيرُوا فِي الْأَرْضِ ثُمَّ انْظُرُوا كَيْفَ كَانَ عَاقِبَةُ الْمُكَذِّبِينَ
occurrences.english_translation: Say: "Travel through the earth and see what was the end of those who rejected Truth."

occurrences.arabic_text: انْظُرْ كَيْفَ كَذَبُوا عَلَىٰ أَنْفُسِهِمْ وَضَلَّ عَنْهُمْ مَا كَانُوا يَفْتَرُونَ
occurrences.english_translation: Behold! how they lie against their own souls! But the (lie) which they invented will leave them in the lurch.

occurrences.arabic_text: انْظُرْ كَيْفَ نُصَرِّفُ الْآيَاتِ ثُمَّ هُمْ يَصْدِفُونَ
occurrences.english_translation: Say: "Think ye, if Allah took away your hearing and your sight, and sealed up your hearts, who - a god other than Allah - could restore them to you?" See how We explain the signs by various (symbols); yet they turn aside.

occurrences.arabic_text: انْظُرْ كَيْفَ نُصَرِّفُ الْآيَاتِ لَعَلَّهُمْ يَفْقَهُونَ
occurrences.english_translation: Say: "He hath power to send calamities on you, from above and below, or to cover you with confusion in party strife, giving you a taste of mutual vengeance - each from the other." See how We explain the signs by various (symbols); that they may understand.

occurrences.arabic_text: وَكَيْفَ أَخَافُ مَا أَشْرَكْتُمْ وَلَا تَخَافُونَ أَنَّكُمْ أَشْرَكْتُمْ بِاللَّهِ
occurrences.english_translation: "How should I fear (the beings) ye associate with Allah, when ye fear not to give partners to Allah without any warrant having been given to you? Which of (us) two parties hath more right to security? (tell me) if ye know.

occurrences.arabic_text: وَأَمْطَرْنَا عَلَيْهِمْ مَطَرًا فَانْظُرْ كَيْفَ كَانَ عَاقِبَةُ الْمُجْرِمِينَ
occurrences.english_translation: And we rained down on them a shower (of brimstone): Then see what was the end of those who indulged in sin and crime!

occurrences.arabic_text: وَانْظُرُوا كَيْفَ كَانَ عَاقِبَةُ الْمُفْسِدِينَ
